title: The Sewtionary - An A to Z Guide to 101 Sewing Techniques and De
description:
The Sewtionary: An A to Z Guide to 101 Sewing Techniques and Definitions 
by Tasia St. Germaine
KP Craft | July 2014 | ISBN-10: 1440238324 | ePUB | 274 pages | 47.8 mb

From "applique" to "zippers" and everything in between!

Tasia St. Germaine of Sewaholic shares 101 of the most essential sewing terms and techniques. Presented in an easy-to-use format, this alphabetical reference gives more than just definitions: photographed step-by-step tutorials will guide you through each technique, showing you in detail how to apply the technique to your own projects. No matter what stage you're on in your sewing journey, The Sewtionary is here to help.

Features:
- 101 common sewing terms and techniques, listed alphabetically for easy reference
- Ideas, variations and suggestions to take your sewing to the next level
- Real life examples to help you master techniques

About the Author
Tasia St. Germaine is the owner and founder of Sewaholic Patterns. Founded in 2010, the patterns are sold in over sixty retail shops all over the world. An avid blogger as well, Tasia shares tips and tutorials and engages readers in sewing-related discussions. Tasia/Sewaholic Patterns has been featured in Threads magazine, Sewing World UK and Sew Hip magazine.
